0.title: Pest Watch – January (Scotland)
items: Check overwintered brassicas for pigeons – use netting or fleece.
Botrytis (grey mould) in damp cold frames – ventilate on dry days.
Slugs hiding under pots and debris – clear regularly.

1.title: Pest Watch – February (Scotland)
items: Aphids can appear on early sowings during mild spells.
Slugs damaging salad leaves under cloches.
Mice eating pea and bean seeds stored in sheds or trays.

2.title: Pest Watch – March (Scotland)
items: Flea beetle attacking brassica seedlings – protect with fleece.
Slugs and snails emerging strongly as temperatures rise.
Damping-off fungus in crowded seed trays – improve airflow and avoid overwatering.

3.title: Pest Watch – April (Scotland)
items: Cabbage root fly – protect brassicas with collars.
Carrot fly becomes active – use fine netting or fleece barriers.
Slugs active on seedlings – set traps and hand-pick at dusk.

4.title: Pest Watch – May (Scotland)
items: Aphids colonising beans and brassicas – encourage ladybirds.
Cabbage white butterflies laying eggs on brassicas – check undersides of leaves.
Blackfly on broad beans – pinch out infested shoot tips.

5.title: Pest Watch – June (Scotland)
items: Potato blight risk rises in warm, damp weather – remove affected leaves promptly.
Pea moth caterpillars – use insect mesh over crops.
Whitefly on greenhouse tomatoes and cucumbers – use sticky traps and ventilation.

6.title: Pest Watch – July (Scotland)
items: Powdery mildew on courgettes – water at soil level and remove infected leaves.
Tomato blight spreads in wet conditions – maintain good airflow.
Cabbage white caterpillars – hand-pick or use mesh netting.

7.title: Pest Watch – August (Scotland)
items: Blight peak risk for potatoes and tomatoes – harvest early if needed.
Onion white rot risk – rotate crops and avoid replanting in same soil.
Fruit flies around soft fruit – harvest promptly, avoid fallen fruit.

8.title: Pest Watch – September (Scotland)
items: Slugs thrive in damp conditions – use beer traps or copper barriers.
Grey mould on autumn salads – increase ventilation.
Rodents raiding stored crops – secure storage areas.

9.title: Pest Watch – October (Scotland)
items: Clubroot risk on brassicas – lime soil to reduce acidity.
Moulds in damp polytunnels – ventilate regularly.
Rodents near compost heaps – deter with secure bins.

10.title: Pest Watch – November (Scotland)
items: Slug damage under cloches – clear hiding spots and set traps.
Yellowing brassica leaves encourage pests – remove promptly.
Cover leafy veg from pigeons as food sources decline.

11.title: Pest Watch – December (Scotland)
items: Protect stored root crops (carrots, potatoes) from mice and rats.
Ventilate greenhouses on mild days to prevent fungal growth.
Weed around overwintering garlic and onions to reduce pest harbourage.
